pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Clasp is a new Common Lisp implementation that seamlessly interoperates with C++ libraries and programs using LLVM for compilation to native code.
Building Clasp requires that you already have a running CL compiler. This is hard-coded to SBCL due to strong preference from upstream.

use.flag: Build-mode :bytecode-faso rather than the default :faso (LLVM binary format). :bytecode-faso leaves the kernel and modules as FASO but user code is bytecode (faster compilation but slower execution).
